alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 2:46PM EST until February 07 at 1:56AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 9.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 14 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
